inclusion.criterion: pathologic diagnosis of anaplastic astrocytoma defined as WHO grade III or glioblastoma/gliosarcoma, WHO grade IV
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has a history of anaplastic astrocytoma of the spine.

inclusion.criterion: recurrent disease, histologically proven or imaging suggestive of recurrent disease as determined by PI
inclusion.label: not_met

inclusion.criterion: ability to understand and willingness to sign a written informed consent document
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient is described as a 45-year-old man, implying he has the capacity to understand and provide consent.

inclusion.criterion: age greater than or equal to 18 years old
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient is 45 years old, which meets this criterion.

inclusion.criterion: adequate bone marrow function (ANC > 1,500/mm3, platelet count of > 100,000/mm3)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: adequate liver function (ALT and AST< 3 times upper limit normal and alkaline phosphatase < 2 times upper limit normal, total bilirubin < 1.5mg/dl)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: adequate renal function (BUN < 1.5 times institutional normal and serum creatinine < 1.5 mg/dl)
inclusion.label: unknown

inclusion.criterion: tumor tissue must be available for review to confirm histological diagnosis
inclusion.label: met
inclusion.evidence: Patient has undergone biopsy and tumor is located in the T-L spine.

exclusion.criterion: Patients who are receiving any other investigational agents
exclusion.label: triggers

exclusion.criterion: Patients with prior bevacizumab use for tumor treatment
exclusion.label: triggers

notes: Patient's history of anaplastic astrocytoma and current condition suggest eligibility, but lack of information on Karnofsky score, bone marrow function, liver function, renal function, and tumor tissue availability for review makes overall assessment uncertain. Exclusion criteria related to investigational agents and bevacizumab use are likely triggers.
